Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is grey-black in section, interior spotted with a resinous substance and very faint traces of the remains of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.216)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87686) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87686)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 375 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
